definition: to come true/to come about as predicted/to be fulfilled
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: "More than window of a dream" the claim in my practice get fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: “窗下多梦”的说法也在我的实践中得到应验。

sentences.english: I was right in my conjectures.
And he began to say unto them, This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣对他们说，今天这经应验在你们耳中了。

sentences.english: The same holds true for many of the straight-A students I researched for my book.
sentences.chinese: 这两个事实也应验在我书中调查过的许多尖子生身上。

sentences.english: His prayers were all unanswered and so he doesn’t deserve anything.
sentences.chinese: 他的祈祷全都没应验，所以他不配得到任何东西。

sentences.english: And Manoah said, Now let thy words come to pass.
sentences.chinese: 玛挪亚说，愿你的话应验。

sentences.english: Through Elisha God's word was completely fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 神借以利沙所说的话完全应验了。
凯思的预言应验了，我们该由此得出什么结论？

sentences.english: Today this scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.
sentences.chinese: 今天这经应验在你们耳中了。

sentences.english: 22For this is the time of punishment in fulfillment of all that has been written.
sentences.chinese: 因为这是报应的日子，使经上所写的都得应验。

sentences.english: What are the chances of Bible prophecy not coming to pass?
sentences.chinese: 以下节录自圣经中的预言有可能不应验吗？

sentences.english: But all this was done, that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 但这一切的事成就了，为要应验先知书上的话。

sentences.english: He prayed that all your prayers would be answered.
sentences.chinese: 他祈祷让你的祈求都能应验。

sentences.english: If those predictions are right, global unemployment will hit a record.
sentences.chinese: 如果这些预测应验，全球失业率将又创新高。

sentences.english: Did what the fortune-teller said come true?
sentences.chinese: 算命人说的话应验了吗？

sentences.english: So was fulfilled what was said through the prophets: "He will be called a Nazarene."
sentences.chinese: 这是要应验先知所说，他将称为拿撒勒人的话了。

definition: (idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
to have one's words prove to be prophetic
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
crow's beak/(fig.) person who makes an inauspicious remark
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2
